Detailed Description

Contains structures and function declarations for time integration.

Author:

Function Documentation

int TimeExplicitRKInitialize ( char *  class,
char *  type,
void *  s,
void *  m 
)

Initialize the explicit Runge-Kutta time-integration method

Initialize the explicit Runge-Kutta time integrator: Depending on the specific explicit Runge-Kutta (ERK) method chosen, this function allocates memory for the Butcher tableaux and sets their coefficients.

Parameters:
class Name of time integrator class; must match _RK_
type Type of explicit Runge-Kutta method
s Object of type ExplicitRKParameters
m Unused argument

00088     fprintf(stderr,"coding mistake.\n");
00089     return(1);
00090   }
00091   return(0);

int TimeExplicitRKCleanup ( void *  s  ) 

Clean up variables related to the explicit Runge-Kutta time-integration method

Clean up allocations related to explicit Runge-Kutta time integration: This function frees up the arrays for the Butcher tableaux.

Parameters:
s Object of type ExplicitRKParameters

Definition at line 12 of file TimeExplicitRKCleanup.c.

00013 {
00014   ExplicitRKParameters *params = (ExplicitRKParameters*) s;
00015   if (params->A) free(params->A);
00016   if (params->b) free(params->b);
00017   if (params->c) free(params->c);
00018   return(0);
00019 }

int TimeGLMGEEInitialize ( char *  class,
char *  type,
void *  s,
void *  m 
)

Initialize the General Linear Methods with Global Error Estimators (GLM-GEE)

Initialize the GLM-GEE (_GLM_GEE_) time integation method: This function allocates the arrays to store the Butcher tableaux, and sets their coefficients, as well as other parameters for the GLM-GEE methods.

Reference: + Constantinescu, E. M., "Estimating Global Errors in Time Stepping.", Submitted, 2015 (http://arxiv.org/abs/1503.05166).

Parameters:
class Class of time integration method; must match _GLM_GEE_
type Name of the _GLM_GEE_ method to use
s Object of type GLMGEEParameters
m MPI object of type MPIVariables

int TimeInitialize ( void *  s,
void *  m,
void *  ts 
)

Initialize the time integration

Initialize time integration: This function initializes all that is required for time integration. + It sets the number of iterations, time step size, simulation time, etc. + It allocates solution, right-hand-side, and stage solution arrays needed by specific time integration methods. + It calls the method-specific initialization functions.

Parameters:
s Solver object of type HyPar
m MPI object of type MPIVariables
ts Time integration object of type TimeIntegration

00060 
00061     /* explicit Runge-Kutta methods */
00062     ExplicitRKParameters  *params = (ExplicitRKParameters*)  solver->msti;
00063     int nstages = params->nstages;
00064     TS->U     = (double**) calloc (nstages,sizeof(double*));
00065     TS->Udot  = (double**) calloc (nstages,sizeof(double*));
00066     for (i = 0; i < nstages; i++) {
00067       TS->U[i]    = (double*) calloc (size,sizeof(double));
00068       TS->Udot[i] = (double*) calloc (size,sizeof(double));
00069     }
00070     TS->BoundaryFlux = (double**) calloc (nstages,sizeof(double*));
00071     for (i=0; i<nstages; i++) 
00072       TS->BoundaryFlux[i] = (double*) calloc (2*solver->ndims*solver->nvars,sizeof(double));
00073   
00074   } else if (!strcmp(solver->time_scheme,_GLM_GEE_)) {
00075     
00076     /* General Linear Methods with Global Error Estimate */
00077     GLMGEEParameters *params = (GLMGEEParameters*) solver->msti;
00078     int nstages = params->nstages;
00079     int r       = params->r;
00080     TS->U     = (double**) calloc (2*r-1  ,sizeof(double*));
00081     TS->Udot  = (double**) calloc (nstages,sizeof(double*));
00082     for (i=0; i<2*r-1; i++)   TS->U[i]    = (double*) calloc (size,sizeof(double));
00083     for (i=0; i<nstages; i++) TS->Udot[i] = (double*) calloc (size,sizeof(double));
00084     TS->BoundaryFlux = (double**) calloc (nstages,sizeof(double*));
00085     for (i=0; i<nstages; i++) 
00086       TS->BoundaryFlux[i] = (double*) calloc (2*solver->ndims*solver->nvars,sizeof(double));
00087     
00088     if (!strcmp(params->ee_mode,_GLM_GEE_YYT_)) {
00089       for (i=0; i<r-1; i++) _ArrayCopy1D_(solver->u,TS->U[r+i],size);
00090     } else {
00091       for (i=0; i<r-1; i++) _ArraySetValue_(TS->U[r+i],size,0.0);
00092     }
00093   }
00094 
00095   /* set right-hand side function pointer */
00096   TS->RHSFunction = TimeRHSFunctionExplicit;
00097 
00098   /* open files for writing */
00099   if (!mpi->rank) {
00100     if (solver->write_residual) TS->ResidualFile = (void*) fopen("residual.out","w");
00101     else                        TS->ResidualFile = NULL;
00102   } else                        TS->ResidualFile = NULL;
00103 
00104   solver->time_integrator = TS;
00105   return(0);
00106 }

int TimeError ( void *  s,
void *  m,
double *  uex 
)

Compute/estimate error in solution

Computes the time integration error in the solution: If the time integration method chosen has a mechanism to compute the error in the numerical integration, it is computed in this function. In addition, if an exact solution is available (see function argument uex, the error of the computed solution (stored in HyPar::u) with respect to this exact solution is also computed. These errors are written to a text file whose name depends on the time integration method being used.

Time integration method with error estimation currently implemented: + _GLM_GEE_ (General Linear Methods with Global Error Estimation) (see TimeGLMGEE(), TimeGLMGEEInitialize() )

Parameters:
s Solver object of type HyPar
m MPI object of type MPIVariables
uex Exact solution (stored with the same array layout as HyPar::u (may be NULL)

00056     /* L1 */

00074                            solver->ghosts,solver->index,Uerr);

00077     /* calculate L2 norm of error */
00078     sum = ArraySumSquarenD(solver->nvars,solver->ndims,solver->dim_local,
00079                            solver->ghosts,solver->index,Uerr);
00080     global_sum = 0; MPISum_double(&global_sum,&sum,1,&mpi->world);

00086     error[2] = global_sum;
00087 
00088     if (uex) {
00089       _ArrayAXBY_(TS->Udot[0],1.0,solver->u,-1.0,uex,size);
00090       _ArrayAXPY_(Uerr,-1.0,TS->Udot[0],size);
00091       /* calculate L1 norm of error */
00092       sum = ArraySumAbsnD   (solver->nvars,solver->ndims,solver->dim_local,
00093                              solver->ghosts,solver->index,TS->Udot[0]);
00094       global_sum = 0; MPISum_double(&global_sum,&sum,1,&mpi->world);

00105       error[5] = global_sum;
00106     } else error[3] = error[4] = error[5] = -1;
00107 
00108     if (   (sol_norm[0] > tolerance)
00109         && (sol_norm[1] > tolerance)
00110         && (sol_norm[2] > tolerance) ) {
00111       error[0] /= sol_norm[0];
00112       error[1] /= sol_norm[1];
00113       error[2] /= sol_norm[2];
00114       if (uex) {
00115         error[3] /= sol_norm[0];
00116         error[4] /= sol_norm[1];
00117         error[5] /= sol_norm[2];
00118       }
00119     }
00120 
00121     /* write to file */
00122     if (!mpi->rank) {
00123       FILE *out;
00124       out = fopen("glm_err.dat","w");
00125       fprintf(out,"%1.16E  %1.16E  %1.16E  %1.16E  ",TS->dt,error[0],error[1],error[2]);
00126       fprintf(out,"%1.16E  %1.16E  %1.16E\n",error[3],error[4],error[5]);
00127       fclose(out);
00128       printf("Estimated time integration errors (GLM-GEE time-integration):-\n");
00129       printf("  L1         Error           : %1.16E\n",error[0]);
00130       printf("  L2         Error           : %1.16E\n",error[1]);
00131       printf("  Linfinity  Error           : %1.16E\n",error[2]);
00132     }
00133   }

00135   return(0);
00136 }

int TimeGetAuxSolutions ( int *  N,
double **  uaux,
void *  s,
int  n 
)

Function to get auxiliary solutions if available (for example, in GLM-GEE methods)

Return auxiliary solution: Some time integrators may have the concept of auxiliary solutions that they evolve along with the main solution HyPar::u (these may be used for error estimation, for example). This function returns a pointer to such an auxiliary solution. Note that the auxiliary solution has the same dimensions and array layout as the main solution. + Call with the final argument n less than 0 to get the total number of auxiliary solutions (this value will be stored in the argument N at exit). + Call with the final argument n less than or equal to zero to get the n-th auxiliary solution (the argument uaux will point to this at exit).

Note that auxiliary solutions are numbered in the C convention: 0,1,...,N-1.

Time integration methods which use auxiliary solutions currently implemented: + General Linear Methods with Global Error Estimators (GLM-GEE - _GLM_GEE_) (see TimeGLMGEE(), TimeGLMGEEInitialize() ).

Parameters:
N Number of auxiliary solutions
uaux Pointer to the array holding the auxiliary solution
s Solver object of type HyPar
n Index of the auxiliary solution to return

00040     if (!strcmp(solver->time_scheme,_GLM_GEE_)) {
00041       GLMGEEParameters *params = (GLMGEEParameters*) solver->msti;
00042       *uaux = TS->U[params->r+n];
00043     }
00044   } else {
00045     if (!TS) *N = 0;
00046     else {

00048         GLMGEEParameters *params = (GLMGEEParameters*) solver->msti;
00049         *N = params->r - 1;
00050       } else *N = 0;
00051     }
00052   }

int TimeRK ( void *  ts  ) 

Take a step in time using the explicit Runge-Kutta method

Advance the ODE given by

by one time step of size HyPar::dt using the forward Euler method given by

where the subscript represents the time level, the superscripts represent the stages, is the time step size HyPar::dt, and is computed by TimeIntegration::RHSFunction. The Butcher tableaux coefficients are (ExplicitRKParameters::A) and (ExplicitRKParameters::b).

Note: In the code TimeIntegration::Udot is equivalent to .

Parameters:
ts Object of type TimeIntegration

Definition at line 30 of file TimeRK.c.

00031 {
00032   TimeIntegration       *TS     = (TimeIntegration*) ts;
00033   HyPar                 *solver = (HyPar*)           TS->solver;
00034   MPIVariables          *mpi    = (MPIVariables*)    TS->mpi;
00035   ExplicitRKParameters  *params = (ExplicitRKParameters*)  solver->msti;
00036   int                   d, stage, i;
00037   _DECLARE_IERR_;
00038 
00039   int size = 1;
00040   for (d=0; d<solver->ndims; d++) size *= (solver->dim_local[d]+2*solver->ghosts);
00041 
00042   /* Calculate stage values */
00043   for (stage = 0; stage < params->nstages; stage++) {
00044     double stagetime = TS->waqt + params->c[stage]*TS->dt;
00045     _ArrayCopy1D_(solver->u,TS->U[stage],size*solver->nvars);
00046     for (i = 0; i < stage; i++) {
00047       _ArrayAXPY_(TS->Udot[i],solver->dt*params->A[stage*params->nstages+i],
00048                   TS->U[stage],size*solver->nvars); 
00049     }
00050     if (solver->PreStage)
00051       { IERR solver->PreStage(stage,TS->U ,solver,mpi,stagetime); CHECKERR(ierr); }
00052     IERR TS->RHSFunction(TS->Udot[stage],TS->U[stage],solver,mpi,stagetime);
00053     if (solver->PostStage) 
00054       { IERR solver->PostStage(TS->U[stage],solver,mpi,stagetime); CHECKERR(ierr); }
00055 
00056     _ArraySetValue_(TS->BoundaryFlux[stage],2*solver->ndims*solver->nvars,0.0);
00057     _ArrayCopy1D_(solver->StageBoundaryIntegral,TS->BoundaryFlux[stage],2*solver->ndims*solver->nvars);
00058   }
00059 
00060   /* Step completion */
00061   for (stage = 0; stage < params->nstages; stage++) {
00062     _ArrayAXPY_(TS->Udot[stage],solver->dt*params->b[stage],solver->u,size*solver->nvars);
00063     _ArrayAXPY_(TS->BoundaryFlux[stage],solver->dt*params->b[stage],solver->StepBoundaryIntegral,
00064                 2*solver->ndims*solver->nvars);
00065   }
00066 
00067   return(0);
00068 }

Take a step in time using the General Linear Methods with Global Error Estimators

Advance the ODE given by

by one time step of size HyPar::dt using the -stage General Linear Method with Global Error Estimation (GLM-GEE), given by

where the superscripts in parentheses represent stages, the subscripts represent the time level, the superscripts without parentheses represent auxiliary solutions, is the time step size HyPar::dt, are the auxiliary solutions, and is computed by TimeIntegration::RHSFunction. The coefficients defining this methods are: + (GLMGEEParameters::A) + (GLMGEEParameters::B) + (GLMGEEParameters::C) + (GLMGEEParameters::D)

where is the number of stages (GLMGEEParameters::nstages) and is the number of auxiliary solutions propagated with the solution (GLMGEEParameters::r).

Note: In the code TimeIntegration::Udot is equivalent to .

References: + Constantinescu, E. M., "Estimating Global Errors in Time Stepping.", Submitted, 2015 (http://arxiv.org/abs/1503.05166).

Parameters:
ts Object of type TimeIntegration

00084     for (i=1; i<r; i++) _ArrayAXPY_(Uaux[i-1],D[j*r+i]   ,U[j],size);

00091   _ArrayCopy1D_(U[0],solver->u,size);
